title: Absorbing Art
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 21, East Wall
description: A man sits on a bench in the middle of a room. He is wearing a red sport coat, a white shirt, a dark green vest, a blue-and-red striped tie, blue pants, and brown lace up shoes; his hands rest upon his thighs. Two paintings hang on the wall behind him: the one on the left appears to depict the bust of a religious figure or icon, and the one on the right, which is only partially visible, depicts two brown overlapping triangles on a blue background. A woman seated at a desk can be seen through the doorway in the background; she has dark blonde hair and is wearing a blue top. A book lays open on the desk in front of her and a window is open over her right shoulder.

title: Afternoon of a Faun (The Concert) [L'AprÃ¨s-midi d'un faune (le concert)]
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 20, West Wall
description: A faun, seated in the lower left corner in the foreground, plays a set of pipes, while women cavort in the grassy countryside that is interrupted by a curving river. In the foreground, a female figure sits facing the faun in the lower right corner. In the middleground, one woman reclines while another dips her leg into the stream. In the farground another female reclines on her stomach, while two chase each other near the edge of the stream.

title: Albastron
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 15, East Wall Cabinet, Top Shelf
description: A tall, ovoid alabastron with a pierced lug handle, a flat, overhanging rim, a narrow neck, and a flat foot. On the top of the rim is a red band with black and reserved white circles. There are dots on the outside of the rim. On the neck are teardrops in black and red, below which horizontal lines frame red and black dots. In the main zone are huge palmettes to the left and right, with a stylized palmette-lotus motif in the center. Below the handle is rosette and blob filler ornament. There are stripes on the bottom zone of the body and concentric black-brown circles on the bottom.

title: Andiron (Landiers en Hastiers)
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 14, East Wall

title: Animal-shaped Askos
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 15, East Wall Cabinet, Bottom Shelf
description: A molded vessel in the shape of a composite sea mammal (possibly a dolphin and a pig?) with a long snout, bulging eyes, ears, a dorsal fin, and a turned up tail. There is a spout in the middle of the back with a ring handle, and a hole in the snout for feeding or pouring. The piece is glazed in black.

title: Bather in Three-Quarter View (Baigneuse vue de trois quarts)
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 07, East Wall
description: A nude woman is shown from the back with her body in three-quarter view, and she sits on top of a white cloth which she gathers between her legs. An imposing tree trunk in the background augments the sense of verticality in the painting.

title: Bathers (Baigneuses)
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 06, East Wall
description: The painting depicts five nude female bathers in a landscape. There are three figures in the foreground: one reclines with her back to the viewer, her body parallel to the picture plane. Another stands to the right, her hands in her hair. A third, partially-clothed figure with dark hair is presented at left. Two more bathers can be seen in the distance.

title: Bathers at Rest (Baigneurs au repos)
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 08, East Wall
description: Four figures in a landscape. On the left, a figure lies on his back with his arms crossed underneath his head and his right knee bent up. Behind him, another figure, whose back is turned toward the viewer, stretches his left arm up over his head. In the center, a figure in blue shorts stands with his hands on his hips as he peers down into the stream below him. On the right, a figure wearing shorts stands in the stream, with his right leg propped up on the bank of the creek. He looks over his right shoulder. A mountain rises in the background.

title: Belt
dimensions: Overall (as mounted): 2 3/4 x 37 x 2 in. (7 x 94 x 5.1 cm)
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 15, North Wall Cabinet, Bottom Shelf
description: A belt with seven sheet silver cut conchos with back hammered repousse dome and secondary leaf forms with a turquoise stone in center. locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 14, West Wall

title: Blanket
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 24, East Wall
description: A classic child's / woman's blanket made with Churro wool and commercial twisted three-ply tabs and edging indigo dyed.  Additionally, Saxony-aniline dye base for red body of textile. Decoration includes three panel grid of back (center), sides and front with the beginning of interconnected "x" pattern, but not in this case fully realized since design units remain isloated as serrated rounded diamonds.

title: Blue Still Life (Nature morte bleue)
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 11, East Wall
description: A group of objects are posed on a table in an interior. The table, depicted close up and in the foreground, is large and fills the lower half of the canvas. The objects on the table, which is entirely covered by a white tablecloth with a curving, blue floral motif, consist mainly of a number of red, green, yellow and orange pieces of fruit spread out from end to end and piled on a white plate in the center of the table. Three pots of various heights are placed on the right side of the table; from front to back, these are: a small green pitcher with a round handle and a spout on either end, a large light-blue pot or jug with two round handles, an ornate lid, and a spout at its base, and, lastly, a short, green pot from which emerge the red and white tendrils of a plant. Behind the table, taking up most of the background space on the left, are two panels of a decorated folding-screen; the panel on the left has a floral motif of entwined pink, yellow, blue, and lavender flowers with green leaves on a whitish-pink ground, and the panel on the right is light blue. Each panel is bordered on the right by a vertical strip of brown wood. In the right corner, a green curtain has been pushed to the far right to reveal a thin, vertical strip of green, pink, blue and lavender that might be depicting foliage and flowers, visible in the garden beyond what is assumedly an open door. Light enters the scene from the right, shining brightly in spots of white paint on the pots, jugs and fruit on the table; these objects cast long shadows to the left on the tabletop and screen behind them.

title: Blue Villa
medium: Oil on academy board (later mounted to cradled panel)
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 10, West Wall
description: A white villa with a blue roof and a yellow door is depicted in the center of a landscape setting. The villa sits in the middle ground, while scattered brown and green bushes appear in the foreground. The branches of a green tree with delicate white blooms are visible on the right. On the left a tall tree with gray foliage takes up most of the foreground. In the background on the left, the hills behind the villa slope down towards the bay of Nice, which is painted with bright pink paint. The sky, dark blue in some areas and lighter blue close to the horizon, breaks through gray and purplish clouds.

locations: External Location ()
description: A seated gray and orange cat.

title: Celery Vase
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 18, East Wall Cupboard, Top Shelf
description: A blown molded celery vase with an engraved swag and flower design set on a foot.  The lower portion is decorated with a band of contiguous panels.

title: Cellaret
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Parkway, Temporary Art Storage
description: A cellarett with a hinged lid and a valanced skirt set on cabriole legs and claw-and-ball feet, with seashells incised on the knees.

title: Central Park
medium: Tempera, gold, and silver leaf on incised, gessoed panel
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 09, West Wall

medium: Gouache and black crayon on gray wove paper

title: Chest
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 02, North Wall
description: A painted chest set on block feet. The chest is predominantly red with three painted arched panels with white grounds on the front. The center arch is decorated with two confrontal rampant unicorns on both sides of a tree. The side arches are decorated with potted flowers. On the center of the lid is a star flanked by two abraded rectangular designs, which appear to have been potted flowers and might have contained a date.

title: Chest over Drawers
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 07, East Wall
description: A painted chest with ogee feet and two drawers with brass pulls. The body is predominately green. The front is divided into three squares: the outside squares are decorated with red and green tulips on a white ground, and the center square has a heart inscribed with the owners name and date. Each side of the chest has a square decorated with tulips. The top is green with a red rectangle in the middle.

title: Chest over Drawers
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 06, South Wall

title: Chinese Casket (Le Coffret chinois)
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 10, South Wall
description: Two women, one with light colored hair and the other with dark hair, are seated behind and to the left of a table covered by a blue table cloth with a pink, yellow, and dark-blue pattern. A group of objects sit on the table: a Chinese box, a white bowl holding a bouquet of pink roses, a white compote on which sit a bunch of green grapes and two quince; behind this is another bouquet of dark pink roses. The wall behind the two women is covered with two different patterned wall hangings: on the left a dark pink paper with light pink flowers and on the right a blue paper with white flowers.

title: Christ as the Man of Sorrows
medium: Tempera, with brown ink scribe lines, inscribed red ink, and gold and silver on parchment
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 16, East Wall
description: Christ in white drapery holding a palm frond and scourge. He wears the crown of thorns and has the stigmata. Symbols of the Passion appear against the background. A monk appears to the left in front of an open book.

title: Christ on the Mount of Olives with Three Apostles; Saints Stephen and Lawrence
dimensions: Overall (with frame): 28 1/8 x 55 x 2 3/4 in. (71.4 x 139.7 x 7 cm)
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Mezzanine
description: Triptych carved in relief. On the left panel, Saint Stephen holds the stones of his martyrdom in the folds of his dalmatic. On the right panel, Saint Lawrence holds a book and the handle of the missing grate of his martyrdom. The central scene depicts Christ on the Mount of Olives, or Agony in the Garden, with Christ kneeling in prayer and three of the sleeping apostles. Saint Peter, who lies prone at the right, holds a sword and book at the lower right. Other figures enter a gate in the background. A gold chalice stands on rocks to the left.

title: Composition, Five Bathers (Composition, cinq baigneuses)
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 08, South Wall
description: A group of five female bathers in the woods. In the left foreground, a nude figure stands facing the viewer and drapes a towel behind her. Three figures to the right are clothed: one is seated with a hat, one reclines in the middleground, and the third, just at the right edge of the canvas, can be seen fixing her hair. Behind these three is a fourth bather, nude, standing with her back to the viewer and her arms raised, as if clutching tree branches to climb out of the water.

title: Covered Bowl
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 11, East Wall
description: This small, wheel-thrown bowl has a narrow, molded band around the base. The bottom is flat. The round, engaged handles are secured with finger pushes at the midsection of the bowl. The top edge of the bowl flares slightly, becoming flat on top. The lid has a flared, flat edge, which sits on the edge of the bowl, and a flange that fits inside the top edge of the bowl. The knop is raised from the clay of the lid. A pattern of manganese and white slip dots, some daubed with copper oxide, which resembles the number "9" or commas, encircles the body about midsection and the lid near the knop. In between the "commas" at the top and bottom are two short, wispy lines, like apostrophes, in white slip. The edge of the lid is decorated with a band of white slip that is finely stippled in concentric lines (about five lines). The handles also had a border design in white slip that has popped off. The bowl and lid are covered with a very orange-colored lead glaze.

title: Covered Bowl
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 11, East Wall
description: This bowl is composed of four wheel-thrown bowls. The outer lid and lower body are decorated with cuts in bands of interlocking swags and encircling bands of pierced dots. The inner bowls are secured to the outer bowls at the edges. The handles are made of two round clay "worms" that are twisted and secured with a clear, single finger push on each side. The knop is buttonlike. The whole bowl is covered inside and outside with a clear reddish lead glaze.

title: Covered Jar
medium: Earthenware with polychrome decoration over tin-glaze
locations: Barnes Foundation (Merion), Gallery, G15, North Wall
description: A jar set on a pedestal base with a bulbous body which narrows at the neck.  The lip is out-turned and the piece has two knob handles.  The jar has a white background glaze, with red and yellow fruit and green leaves and is edged in brown and green.  The lid is decorated in a white background and yellow and red fruit with green leaves and has a knob handle which is green and edged in brown.

title: Covered Jar
medium: Earthenware with polychrome decoration over tin-glaze
locations: Barnes Foundation (Merion), Gallery, G18
description: A jar with applied knob handles painted blue and an overglaze pattern of peaches.The lid to object number 90.06.18a, which rests deep in the pot and has a handle.

title: Covered Jar
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 09, South Wall
description: This round storage jar was raised from a tight coil that is evident on the bottom. The jar has three encircling lines at the shoulder. It has a raised lid with a peak. The knop was pulled from the body of the lid. The lid has a flange, which extends into the top of the jar making it very secure. The lid has three encircling lines. The two extruded handles on the jar extend horizontally. Their terminals are pressed and smoothed into the body of the vessel. The jar was covered with an orange lead glaze and then was daubed in bold splotches of white slip and manganese. The jar was then covered with a clear lead glaze.

title: Covered Jar
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 12, North Wall
description: This is a full, robust, wheel-thrown vessel. Three incised lines encircle the body at the shoulder. It has extruded handles that extend horizontally and are free; their terminals are pulled flat and blended with the body of the jar. The lid has a flange that fits into the top of the jar. It is wheel-thrown and raised to a peak. The knop was pulled from the clay at the top of the lid rather than formed and attached separately. Two incised lines encircle the lid. The red clay is covered with an orange lead glaze and boldly daubed with white slip as well as white slip colored with copper oxide (green).

title: Crock
dimensions: Overall: 7 x 8 3/4 x 8 in. (17.8 x 22.2 x 20.3 cm)
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 08, West Wall
description: The handles on this storage crock were formed from rolled clay and were pressed to the sides. Three male heads in profile are painted in cobalt: on the left, facing right with a beard and prominent buttons is General Grant; in the middle facing left with a pointed nose and striped shoulders is probably Abraham Lincoln; and on the right, facing left, is an old man's head with a big nose, an open mouth inscribed "Lee."

title: Dishes and Melon (Assiettes et melon)
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 23, West Wall
description: The painting, a still life in an interior, depicts a group of objects and vegetables arranged on a table with a white top. From left to right on the upper part of the table the objects are: a black vase, a plaster statuette of a standing figure, a glass carafe with two spouts and a round handle, an octagonal, decorated white plate leaning against the wall, and a green striped melon. From left to right on the lower part of the table are: a red scarf, a bowl with a lip and a small handle, and an onion on a decorated white plate. Light enters from a window on the left illuminating the objects on the table while the right side of the canvas remains in shadow.

title: Domino Players (Les Joueuses de dominos)
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 19, South Wall
description: Two young women sit in a room at a pedestal table playing dominos in front of a French window. The woman on the left is depicted in profile, her left arm rests on the table and her knees are crossed. She wears a blue dress, the bodice of which is embroidered with a white pattern, and black shoes. The woman on the right faces the viewer, her right elbow rests on the table, and her knees are crossed. She wears a green and grey dress and black shoes. In the corner of the room is a dressing table with an oval mirror. Behind the table, the bottom of a white curtain is visible and through the window, which is covered by a transparent curtain, a palm tree.

title: Drama in the Living Room
medium: Watercolor, charcoal, and graphite on paperboard
locations: Barnes Foundation (Merion), Gallery, G30, Flat File, Drawer 11
description: Three figures on the left side.  Two men face one another.  The man on the right is wearing a tuxedo, with both hands resting on a cane.  The man on the left wears a long overcoat.  A woman stands behind the man on the left, wearing a maid's uniform.  A chandelier hangs above the man on the right.    There is a fireplace and mantle in the middle of the background.  Two lamps sit on the mantle and a painting hangs over it.  There are two sets of double doors, one on either side of the mantle.  To the right of the fireplace is an upholstered armchair.  On the left wall, a painting hangs over a table.

title: Dramatic Poetry (Aeschylus)

title: Female Head
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 16, North Wall Cabinet, Top Shelf
description: A female head in a frontal pose, wearing a veil, with a tall polos, above which joins with a flat back. The interior is hollow and the top of the polos is open. A roll of hair with vertical striations frames the face. The head has a low forehead, almond eyes, a fine, straight nose, prominent cheekbones, an archaic smile, and a slightly jutting chin. There are locks of hair below crude ears. The back is flat.

title: Female Head
dimensions: Overall (with mount): 13 3/8 x 6 1/4 x 6 3/4 in. (34 x 15.9 x 17.1 cm)
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 16, East Wall Cabinet, Bottom Shelf
description: A half-lifesize female head turned up and to her left. She has a bow-knot on top of her head, a thick chignon at the nape of her neck, locks of hair falling on her shoulder, small curls in front of her ears, and a narrow band around her head. The drilling is deep in some places throughout the hair. The woman has fine facial features: sharp brows, a fine nose, eyes with well-defined lids, high cheekbones, a small, carefully formed mouth, and a full chin. The neck has a fleshy fold and some incisions for folds. The back of the head is less well-defined with wavy locks.

title: Figure with Bouquet
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 17, East Wall
description: A woman wearing a blue shirt and a black skirt sits in a chair in a room reading a book. She has short, dark, curly hair and wears no shoes. On her right is a chest on which sit three lemons, a small cup, a magazine or black and white photograph, and a red vase with a bouquet of white daisies, lavender pincushions, and green branches. A large square area on the wall behind the bouquet is painted red, while the rest of the room is painted in various tones of blue and light blue. The vague outlines of a door appear behind her.

title: Figure with a Persian Robe (Figure Ã  la robe persane)
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 11, South Wall
description: A woman dressed in Oriental clothing leans against a wall. In her right hand she holds an object that could be a hat, while her left hand is propped on her hip. She wears a long orange Oriental robe with a yellow pattern and long flowing sleeves. The robe reveals white transparent trousers and a large purple sash. Her black hair is tied back in a blue scarf. She wears red Oriental slippers and a necklace. On the left side behind her right arm, are three vertical stripes: a green stripe runs along the left edge of the canvas, next to it a pink stripe and finally a white stripe (the pink and white stripes are only partially visible behind her body). Behind the figure on the right is a couch with a pink top, on which sits a round yellow object. Behind the woman is a diamond patterned purple-blue moucharaby screen.

title: Flying Eros
displayDate: possibly 3rd century BCEâ€“2nd century CE; or possibly modern
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 16, North Wall Cabinet, Top Shelf
description: A winged, flying Eros with his body twisted to his right, holding his right arm up and clutching a bunch of grapes. His left arm is slightly bent at his left side (with a strut attaching it to the body). His head is turned to the right, looking at the grapes. His wings are spread to the left and right. There is a bow knot above the head, with curls to the left and right. His legs are set with the right one back and the left one foreward, both on tiptoe. The mount obscures the back a bit, but it may be using a small vent hole behind the head.

title: Flying Eros
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 16, North Wall Cabinet, Top Shelf
description: A young flying Eros with his right leg in advance of the left with the toes pointed. His right arm is bent across the front of his body and his left arm is bent and held forward. Both hands are partially missing, but they once held an object, also now missing. The figure has a small head turned to the right and is wearing a wreath with large flowers at the front. He has fine facial features that are slightly blurred. There are no holes in the tops of the shoulders for wings. In the back is a circular vent hole and above, behind the shoulders, is a "hang hole." Above the buttocks are two small holes, which have been plugged. The piece is hollow and covered in part with white slip. Some black specks and circles on the piece indicate contact with a carbonized material.

title: Food Bowl
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Lower Level, Cabinet 1 Shelf 1, Middle
description: A Zuni polychrome food bowl with black trim, a black underbody and base, and crazed white body slip. The bowl is made of buff surface clay with a gray-black interior and quartz tempering. The bowl is decorated with a three-fold rotational central layout in an encircling interior band, surmounted by two separating bands with line breaks. Above this unit, a continuous serial repetition of bifold rotational triangular design elements is contained in a zonal band. The central circular motifs are characteristic Zuni rain birds. Spanish influence is seen in the fine filigree cross-hatching. The exterior design shows the characteristic Zuni prayer plume feather motif.

title: Food Bowl
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Lower Level, Cabinet 3 Shelf 1, Middle
description: A Santo Domingo black-on-buff food bowl with a polished red underbody, flat bottom, red-slipped interior, and black rim. The design extends down two-thirds of the sides to the underbody. The decoration consists of a single broad band of serially repeated trapezoids separated by "H" pattern motifs.

medium: Watercolor with graphite underdrawing on thin wove paper

title: Geometric Amphora
displayDate: possibly 8th century BCE, or possibly modern
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 15, East Wall Cabinet, Top Shelf
description: A tall amphora with double handles, a shelf at the shoulders, a pyriform body, and a ring foot. The lip and foot zones are red. The neck has central resting triangles flanked by wavy vertical lines. There are birds and zigzag as fillers. There are two panels on each side of the shoulder zone with deer grazing. There is a lozenge beneath each deer's belly, a bird between its legs, and M designs to the left and right. The body has horizontal stripes.

title: Geometric Amphora
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 15, North Wall Cabinet, Top Shelf
description: An amphora with double handles. There are stripes on the upper neck. Between the handles is a zone with a horse with a bird on its rump, filler ornaments, and flanking stripes. The shoulder zone and handles are black, and the body has an upper zone of groups of zigzags. The rest of the body has horizontal stripes, ending in a black-red ring foot.

title: Harvesters
locations: Barnes Foundation (Merion), Gallery, G30, Frame Bin 6
description: Men and women engaged in various activities related to a hay harvest. A wagon or similar vehicle is parked on the right and several figures work on or around it. Two figures sit on a bale of hay in the left foreground. A man stands behind the bale, next to a large barrel with red stripes. At the left edge, a small figure stands nearby a farmhouse with a red roof and several chimneys.

description: The picture depicts the head and shoulders of a young girl on a pale pink background.  She has brown eyes and brown hair tied with a green ribbon. Her left cheek appears bigger than the right one. She wears a white shirt with a blue collar and possibly a dress, although only two wide, blue straps with a black pattern are visible over the white shirt.

title: Henriot Family (La Famille Henriot)
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Main Room, North Wall
description: Three figures seated in a sun-dappled landscape. The space is shallow and the figures are arranged to form a triangle. To the left a young man sketches in a book. His subject is the red-haired woman seated in the right foreground, at whom he gazes intently; she, in turn, looks out at the viewer. Completing the triangle is a woman in a blue dress in the right background. There are two dogs, one black and one white, in the center of the composition.

title: Here Are Your Trousers
medium: Black crayon and white gouache on thick illustration board
locations: Barnes Foundation (Merion), Gallery, G30, Flat File, Drawer 9
description: A man wearing pajamas and a nightcap stretches while sitting on a bed. A woman in black with her back to he viewer hands him clothing. This is an illustration for Charles Paul de Kock's Jean.
copyright: Rights held by Katherine Degn, Kraushaar Gallery.See Glackens constituent record for contact information

title: High Tide (Pleine mer)
medium: Oil on canvas (later mounted to fiberboard)
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 09, South Wall
description: The sea enters the bay at high tide, rising up onto a stretch of beach that curves around toward the cliffs of Etretat in the background. The sea takes up two-thirds of the lower, left side of the canvas. A series of dark, medium and light blue and green strokes, mixed with a bit of black in some areas, evoke the swells of the sea, and an application of white impasto at the edge of the sea suggests the frothy edge of the ocean as it tumbles onto the shore. The pink toned edges of the waves pick up the light of the setting (or rising sun) visible on the horizon in the upper left. In the right foreground, three figures, one bending down to pick up something, stand at the shoreline. Behind them on the shore is a dark smudge that could be a small boat or caloge. In the background small quick, red and green strokes suggest figures on the shore, while larger black and red strokes cursorily depict the dark and red roofs of buildings in the town. Sandstone cliffs with grassy, green tops rise in the distance along the shore and end in a curved arch out in the sea; on top of them in the distance is a church with a steeple.

title: Horned Ungulate
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 15, North Wall Cabinet, Top Shelf
description: A standing figure of a quadruped with a long snout, pop-eyes, curving, upright horns with small ears behind them, and a slit for a mouth. The body is skinny with an arching tail and short legs. There are slits on the bottom of the hooves to indicate an ungulate. The genitals are broken off.

title: Horse
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 15, North Wall Cabinet, Top Shelf
description: A handmade standing horse with four legs spread in a sturdy stance. The figure has a long, arching neck with a small head. There is a hole pierced through the mouth for the attachment of a bit or bridle(?). The eyes are carefully rendered with a pellet for pupils set into sculptured lids. The nostrils are pierced. There is painted decoration: dilute black-brown and marron paint. The bridle is painted, the mane is rendered as squiggles, there are horizontal stripes on the back, vertical lines down the outside of the legs filled with horizontal lines, dots around the chest, and squiggles running around the chest along the sides.

title: Horse
medium: Brown watercolor and pen and blue ink on ruled blue wove paper
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 17, South Wall
description: A painting of a brown horse with small flowers in the corners.

title: Horse and Rider
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 15, North Wall Cabinet, Top Shelf
description: A handmade, standing horse with a legless rider attached to his back. The horse has a long neck with an arching head, undercut to form a skinny lower nuzzle. The horse has small ears, an applied forelock, convex eyes, a slit for a mouth, and two holes for nostrils. The man is small with a tubular body. His left arm is bent and placed against the horse's mane and his right arm is bent and broken off. The man's face is pinched with depressions for eyes. He wears a small conical hat with a button on the top. There is painted decoration in black and maroon, with squiggles on the neck of the horse and vertical stripes on the legs and tail filled in with horizontal lines. The man has black at the neckline and black and maroon curves defining the back of the arms. The underside of the horse is plain.

title: Houses (Fenouillet) [Les Maisons (Fenouillet)]
medium: Oil on cardboard (later mounted to hardboard and plywood panels)
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 10, West Wall
description: The picture shows a group of houses separated by a street or a court on the edge of a small village. On the left is a group of two or three houses, the first of which has a chimney, a blind wall in the front and a blue wall on the right. On the right across the street or court is a house with a pink roof and a bluish window. The sky is painted with large patches of blue and white, the ground in the foreground is primarily pink with traces of blue in the left bottom corner and green on the bottom right.

title: Hunting the Fashions
medium: Charcoal, watercolor and gouache with graphite on paperboard
locations: Barnes Foundation (Merion), Gallery, G30, Flat File, Drawer 13
description: Two women on the left and a man on the right.  The woman to the far left wears a wide-brimmed hat with feathers coming from the top, a black-and-white jacket and a long black skirt.  She holds a handbag in her right hand.  The woman towards the center is wearing a high black hat, a blue coat and a horizontally striped skirt.  She holds a black umbrella in her left hand and looks at the man that stands on her left (viewer's right).  The man has his left hand on his chest and his right hand in the air, gesturing.  He has a mustache and beard and wears a long suit coat and blue trousers.  Behind the man are two dress forms, one wearing a dress.  In the right corner is a chair draped with fabric.

title: Interior, Nice (Nice, intÃ©rieur)
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 22, North Wall
description: A woman reading a book is seated at a dressing table in a room. The woman sits in a small black chair on the left of the dressing table facing the viewer; in her right hand she holds an open book in her lap while her left arm supports her head. She has long dark hair that falls over her left shoulder and wears a grey dressing gown with magenta trim. On the table, which extends out before her in the foreground and is covered by white fabric, is a gold-framed mirror, two perfume bottles, a little blue jar with a handle, and a tray with a carafe and a glass. Behind her is a pair of French doors; the windowpane of the one on the right is partially covered by a short, translucent white curtain. The door on the left is open (only a tiny section of the front edge is visible behind the long, white curtain on the left), revealing one side of a pair of blue shutters. The French door on the right remains closed, the blue exterior shutter is not visible, and a short violet shutter is open on the inside to reveal the window. On both sides of the French doors, white floor-to-ceiling curtains are pulled back. The blue sea and the shore with green trees and small dark figures is visible through the window.

locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 23, East Wall

The pot has an even salt glaze inside and out.

title: Joint Stool
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 12, West Wall
description: A square-topped joint stool with a paisley cut-out in the seat, vase-turned legs and straight stretchers.

title: Jug
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 02, North Wall
description: This is a tall jug with a rolled base molding, a long extruded handle, and gently curved sides. It has an uneven brownish glaze overall. The design of a dove perched on a branch composed of intersecting lines is seen in profile. It was incised into the body of the jug and painted with cobalt.

title: Jug
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 13, East Wall
description: This is a wheel-thrown stoneware jug. The extruded handles are attached vertically at the neck and shoulder. A bird with a spotted wing and a peacocklike tail is painted freehand in bright blue (cobalt) on the side with the name mark. The bird has a wig-like or very curly crest.
bibliography1: De Mazia, Violette. "The Barnes Foundation: The Display of Its Art Collection." Vistas 2, no. 2 (1981-1983): pl. 117 (installation).

title: Jug

locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 23, South Wall
description: A figure with a blue face juggles several multicolored balls. The figure is wearing a yellow hat and a dark suit with a red-and-blue striped tie.

title: Julia Reading
locations: Barnes Foundation (Merion), Gallery, G15
description: A girl with a ribbon in her hair wears a pink dress with a v-shaped collar and elbow-length sleeves. Her hair is parted in the middle and hangs over her right shoulder. She reads an open book that she holds in her hands.

title: Landscape (Collioure)
medium: Reed pen and black ink on laid paper
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 16, South Wall
description: The scene depicts sailboats in a harbor near the edge of a town. The trunk and branches of a tree appear in the immediate foreground on the left. Next to the tree a path crosses a bridge over a canal and leads up to a house on the right. The silhouettes of Catalan sailboats appear behind the bridge and the surrounding mountains are visible in the background.

title: Le Bonheur de vivre, also called The Joy of Life
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Bonheur de vivre Room, North Wall
description: Nude figures in a landscape. In the lower right corner a male and female embrace. In the center foreground a reclining woman plays horns. In the left middle ground a woman with flowers draped down the front of her body stands with her arms behind her head. A figure in front of her crouches down and reaches forward. Two other figures stand behind. Two women, one with red hair and one with dark hair, recline in the center. The redheaded woman is seen from the back. To the right of them is a figure playing a horn; three goats graze in front of the figure. In the background six figures hold hands and dance in a circle.

title: Le BÃ©al
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 14, South Wall
description: A woman in a white dress and hat stands on a path by the edge of a stream surrounded by trees and rich vegetation. Another figure bends over and leans in toward the stream. Mountains can be seen in the distance.

title: Le Cannet
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 07, South Wall
description: A small figure of a woman in a white dress and a straw hat with a red bow hangs up pieces of white cloth along a fence. She is surrounded by robust trees, and two angular white houses with red roofs are on the right.

title: Leaving the Conservatory (La Sortie du conservatoire)
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 23, East Wall
description: A group of young men and women, almost life-size, set against an undefined background. A red-haired woman in the left foreground holds a rolled-up piece of paper and converses wtih two men wearing dark suits and top hats; another red-haired woman leans casually against her. The canvas is dominated by grays, blacks and blue-ish tones. Less defined figures socialize in the background.

title: Lonesome Ridge Sampler
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 08, South Wall
description: A square sampler with a floral border and an image of a house and a dog.  The top two rows are upper case alphabet and also read, "LONESOME Ridge".  The 3rd row is a lower case alphabet.  The 4th and 5th rows are an upper case alphabet.  The 6th, 7th and 8th rows read, "Nancy Burkholders Sampler was made.  A.D. 1853. Age 10 years and 10 Months."

title: Lulu and Alva SchÃ¶n at Lunch
medium: Watercolor and graphite on wove paper
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 05, North Wall
description: A man and a woman seated at a table.  A word bubble above the man reads, "Are you sick?".  A word bubble above the woman reads, "Let him be!".  A waiter stands next to the table, holds a tray and says, "I am a coocliman usually".  A man up in the balcony says, "My own son!".  There are two more figures partially hidden to the left.  One says "I'll let myself be...that sentiment any time", the second says, "You can't think how glad I shall be to see you".  A man hides under the table.

title: Male Carrying Goat
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 16, North Wall Cabinet, Top Shelf
description: A male figure standing with his left arm at his side, carrying a goat with horns around his shoulder. With his right arm bent, he holds a front and hind leg of the goat against his chest. He wears a conical cap divided into lobes by incisions. His facial features are not sharp. He has a large nose (which may have been repaired) and a small, incised mouth. He wears himation with a gentle diagonal fold across the front. The back of the piece is smoothed, but not carved or meant to be seen. The piece has been waxed and colored orange.

title: Moorish Woman (The Raised Knee) [Femme mauresque (Le Genou levÃ©)]
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 19, North Wall
description: A nude female sits in an arm chair in the corner of a room. She turns at a slight angle in the chair's right corner; her left knee is bent and propped on the left arm of the chair, while the other hangs next to it slightly off the ground. She wears a diaphanous skirt decorated with gold trim or embroidery along the bottom that is attached at the waist by a gold belt, and a green scarf or cloth on her head. She wears three rings on her right hand, a thick, gold necklace around her neck, and a small black cross is marked on her forehead. Behind her the walls are covered with various decorated wall hangings: on the left, the wallpaper has a light background with a brown pattern; directly behind her the wall hanging has a dark purple background with lighter purple flowers and dark leaves, and, just to its right, an Islamic wall covering has a red background and white floral pattern. Below this last wall hanging is an indistinct green square; the floor is redish.

title: Nude on a Blue Couch (Nu au divan bleu)
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 10, West Wall
description: A nude woman reclines on a blue sofa. She rests on her back with her head turned to face the viewer: her legs are bent, her left arm is bent with her hand touching her cheek, and her right arm is thrown back over her head. Her right hand is cropped by the right edge of the canvas and her feet are cut off by the left edge. The bed is covered by a blue fabric, and she leans against a pillow covered by blue and white checked fabric. Behind the figure, the wall is covered with tile-patterned wallpaper consisting of a green grid over pinkish-white squares. On the left part of the canvas is a green rectangle, cropped by the edge of the canvas and partially covered by the right leg of the model.

title: Nude with Blue Necklace (Nu au collier bleu)
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 10, West Wall
description: A nude woman with blond hair is seated on a sofa in an interior. She wears a blue beaded necklace, a gold bracelet on her left arm, a black bracelet on her right arm and covers her legs with a white blanket. The sofa has a blue cover with a black pattern; the pillow behind her is purple with a black pattern. She sits with her lower body parallel to the picture plane, while her torso and face are turned to face the viewer. Her knees are cropped by the left edge of the panel and her head is slightly cropped at the top edge. Behind her on the left is a fireplace with a white curved mantelpiece (also cropped by the left edge). A black bowl sits on the mantelpiece. The brown wall behind her has a white grid pattern that has been incised with a sharp instrument.

locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 13, East Wall
description: This wheel-thrown vessel has a narrow molding around the base and a flat bottom. The body has a gentle but full shape and a generous pouring spout pulled from the upper edge. The lid sits on a ledge inside the upper edge of the pitcher. The knop is vertical rather than button-shaped. The body of the pitcher is daubed with white slip and manganese from its neck to belly. There is a very clear, fine, sparkling lead glaze both inside and out.
bibliography1: De Mazia, Violette. "The Barnes Foundation: The Display of Its Art Collection." Vistas 2, no. 2 (1981-1983): pl. 117 (installation).

title: Pitcher
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 14, East Wall
description: This wheel-thrown pitcher has a slightly flared base with no molded edge. The bottom is flat, and the shape is prim without a belly. The pitcher has a high shoulder, which turns gradually into the neck. The extruded handle is attached at the shoulder and at the mid-line with finger presses. The pitcher is covered with a cream-colored slip wash on the outside and daubed with manganese and copper oxide. The yellowish lead glaze inside and outside is speckled with imperfections.

title: Portrait of Jacques Galos
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 06, East Wall
description: Portrait of a man with greying hair, clean-shaven, with sideburns, turned three-quarters to the right and looking ahead, possibly with his arms folded across his chest. He is dressed in a blue-black jacket with four brass buttons, a white shirt with a stand-up collar and white cravat with a jeweled pin. He is seated on an Empire-style chair whose wooden back is visible on the left and bears Goya's inscription.

title: Pot
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 08, South Wall
description: This wheel-thrown pot has a slightly flared foot and a flat bottom. Two extruded handles with clean, round finger pushes, are secured at the shoulder just under the flange. The horizontal flange extends horizontally to support a lid (which is missing). The top edge rises from this ledge. On two sides the pot has exuberant decoration of freehand paintings of tulips and foliage in white slip that is colored with orange (iron), green (copper oxide), and brown (manganese). A bold zigzag in green (copper oxide) encircles the shoulder just below the flange. The pot has an orange glaze inside and out.

title: Quadraped: Horse
dimensions: Overall: 2 7/8 x 1 x 3 1/4 in. (7.3 x 2.5 x 8.3 cm)
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 15, East Wall Cabinet, Top Shelf
description: A standing quadruped with a snout-like muzzle, upright ears, pop-eyes, defined genitals, and flattened hooves. The body is skinny with a long tail.

title: Quadruped: Horse
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 15, North Wall Cabinet, Top Shelf
description: A standing quadruped, probably a horse, with a snout-like muzzle, a slit for the mouth, and upright ears. The body is skinny with defined genitalia, a long tail, hocks on the back of the back legs, and "knees" defined on the front legs. There is no definition of the hooves.

title: Reclining Figure in a Landscape
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 10, West Wall
description: A young woman rests on a haystack in a green, grassy field. She has brown hair, wears a lavender dress, a black band around her neck and a straw hat. She has her arms folded across her chest and stares out at the viewer.  The yellow haystack, which is covered with a brown blanket, and the figure take up most of the foreground. Green grass, a few tree trunks and a distant horizon line are visible in the background.

title: Reclining Nude (Nu couchÃ©)
displayDate: between the fall of 1923 and the spring of 1924
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 18, East Wall
description: A nude woman reclines on a yellow sofa in a room with a red floor. She rests on violet and red pillows and a white blanket, facing the viewer. Her arms are folded behind her head and her legs are bent up and turned to the right. Behind the sofa is a four-panel folding screen with a pink and green floral pattern on a grey background.

title: Reclining Nude with Blue Eyes (Nu couchÃ© aux yeux bleus)
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 10, East Wall
description: A nude woman with blue eyes wearing a blue bead necklace reclines on a bed. The bed is covered with a red fabric with a pattern of white crescent shapes. title: Red Interior
medium: Oil on tan paper mounted to cradled panel
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 08, South Wall
description: The interior of a room. A woman sits by a table set with dishes and flowers. A chandelier hangs over the table. Three chairs are lined up against the wall in the back right corner of the room. There is a fireplace with a clock and candlestands on its mantel, and a mirror on the left wall. The walls are painted red.

title: Red Madras Headdress (Le Madras rouge)
displayDate: between the end of April and mid-July 1907
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 15, South Wall
description: A woman sits in a straight-backed, wooden, yellow chair. Her arms are crossed in front of her and rest on the back of the chair. She sits sideways on the chair with her legs crossed and her face turned towards the viewer. She wears a red headdress with a yellow, zig-zag pattern, and a blue dress with a red, floral pattern. The v-neck collar, the high, Empire-style waistband and the cuffs of the dress are white with a dark-blue pattern. The area behind her (it is not evident if she is inside or outside) is blue.

title: Red Rug
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 19, North Wall
description: A woman is seated in a yellow, patterned armchair in a room with a decorated red rug. She faces the spectator, resting her left arm on the back of the chair, while her left leg is tucked under her and her right foot touches the ground. She wears a white sheer chemise which bares her right shoulder and breast. A green armchair and a small yellow wooden chair appear in the upper left corner, and to their right is a white door. In the upper right corner, an open violin case rests on a bed from which hangs a multi-colored, striped robe. In the near foreground on the right, about ten paintbrushes are aligned on a small table.

title: Red-Figure Bell Krater
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 15, North Wall Cabinet, Top Shelf
description: A bell krater with a flaring rim, a bell-shaped body, and a tall stepped foot. On the inside of the vessel is black glaze with a reserved red band at the base of the rim. On the outside of the rim is olive leaf decoration. On each side in the main scene is a horse with a man standing beside it in chlamys and boots with a petasos (?) behind his head. On one side the man is in front of the horse, on the other side, behind. There are palmettes below the handles. Egg and dart below ground line. The foot is black with a reserved band above and at the bottom edge.

title: Red-Figure Bird Askos
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 15, North Wall Cabinet, Top Shelf
description: An askos in the shape of a bird with a pointed beak. There is a spout at the back of the head, a conical foot beneath the body, and a ring handle on the back. On side A is a recumbant nude female holding a shield on her left arm and a ball (?) in her right arm. The left foot is turned up and she leans on pillows (?). On side B is a nude winged female (Lasa?) reclining over a black petal decoration. Bird feathers are indicated on the neck, chest, and body

title: Red-Figure Pelike
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 15, East Wall Cabinet, Bottom Shelf
description: A Kerch Style pelike with long, ribbed strap handles from below the rim to the body. The piece has a flaring, open mouth, a long neck, a gentle shoulder to a low, rounded body and a ring foot. The piece is painted with eggs on the outside of the rim and below the figural scene. There is glaze on the handles and sloppy palmettes on the body below and overlapping the handles. On side A is an Amazon with white arms and face in Persian garb, wearing leggings, boots, a swirling cape, and a Phrygian cap. Her right arm is raised, but there is nothing in it. The Amazon rides a rearing horse against a bearded Greek warrior. The warrior has his sword in his right hand and his shield (in white) in his left. He wears a white hat and a himation over his left shoulder. There is an oval shield between the horse's legs, as if knocked from the Amazon's hand. Side B shows facing figures engulfed in himatia. One holds a round object (a large cake or bread?). Between the two is a rectangular monument, an altar.

description: A redheaded woman wears a black dress and is seated with her right arm resting on the chair back.

title: Relief
medium: Limestone with traces of red pigment
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 15, North Wall Cabinet, Bottom Shelf
description: Part of a lintel from a tomb dating to the late Old Kingdom. Executed in raised relief with crudely worked hieroglyphs. Traces of red pigment remain on many of them. The inscription consists of two parts. The uppermost inscription is located in a rectangular area delineated on four sides. Comprised of six columns of hieroglyphs, the text contains an offering inscription invoking the god Anubis and naming the deceased, a man named Jtj (Iti). The lower inscription located within the slightly curving "drum" portion of the lintel contains five columns of text and lists the titles of the deceased. These titles include king's acquaintance, overseer of commissions, estate manager, and scribe. His daughter's name (T(n?)tj) also appears in the lower inscription. Representations of the deceased and his daughter may have appeared in a scene below this inscription.

title: Seated Female
displayDate: possibly late 4thâ€“2nd century BCE, or possibly modern
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 15, North Wall Cabinet, Bottom Shelf
description: A Tanagra type figurine of a female seated on a backless chair with pillows. She is engulfed in a himation. Her right arm is bent with her elbow resting on her right knee and her hand at her chin. Her left arm is resting on her left knee. Her right foot is forward, and her left knee is forward but disappears. The figure has a small head with fine features. Her hair is pulled back. The back of the figurine is added by hand, and there is no definition. The piece is moldmade with the back applied. There is a large square vent hole at the bottom on the back. The piece is covered with white-buff slip.

title: Seated Nude in a Tan Room
medium: Oil on canvas (later mounted to fiberboard)
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 10, East Wall
description: A half-nude woman sits in a tan chair in a room. The woman is posed frontally and stares directly out at the viewer; her legs are crossed and her right arm rests on the armrest of the chair, while her left arm falls across her knee and shin. She has dark hair pulled back, is nude from the waist up, and wears a white skirt or slip with scalloped edges and black shoes and stockings. The chair is placed on a square, yellow carpet or floor covering which only partially covers the red floor of the room. Behind the woman, the wall is covered with wallpaper with a yellow background and green stripes. On the wall hang four, square drawings or pictures of some kind; their content is illegible. Behind her on the right is half of a white door.

title: Seated Riffian (Le Rifain assis)
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Main Room, South Wall
description: A seated Moroccan man is depicted frontally, looking toward the viewer in a room with a window behind him. His hands are folded in front of him and his elbows rest on his knees, which are open and planted firmly in a wide-legged stance. He wears a loose, green, hooded, long-sleeved cloak known as a djellaba, which is decorated with light green trim and various blue, red, orange, green and yellow decorative elements. Under this, he wears a green shirt with a high, round collar and a yellow band that cuts diagonally across his chest. His head is wrapped in an orange and green turban, which is cropped by the top edge of the canvas. He wears ochre, heelless slippers, known as babouches; the one on his left foot touches the bottom of the canvas. He sits on a brown square stool or box. The floor of the room is pinkish-red. Behind the figure on the left, the blue sky appears in a square window or opening of some sort in the yellow wall. An ochre curtain with green stripes hangs on either side of the window; the bottom of the curtain on the right has a horizontal green passage.

title: Sketch for Le Bonheur de vivre
medium: Oil on cardboard (later mounted to plywood panel)
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 10, South Wall
description: In this sketchily rendered picture, nude figures dance and recline in a landscape setting. Next to a green tree trunk on the left is a group of three figures in red outlines. One kneels and two others stand. In the background, a blue horizontal strip and a light pink spot indicate the sea and the sky. Immediately below the blue sea, a little pink brushstroke evokes a group of dancers. To its right and slightly below are two reclining figures, one with orange hair and the second with blue. Three pink figures recline in the foreground on the right: in the middle is a single pink figure and on the right a series of pink strokes indicate two entwining figures. The upper right corner of the picture assembles various patches of dark and light green, pink and yellow which indicate foliage and the yellow blossoms of a tree. On the far right, passages of orange and white may suggest a goatherd and some sheep.

title: Sketch of a Woman (Esquisse de femme)

title: Squash Blossom Necklace
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Lower Level, Cabinet 1 Shelf 2, Left
description: Necklace with graduated silver beads; hanging pendant in circular pattern with two arms that almost touch at bottom; turquoise piece at the end of each arm and one piece at the top of the circle; lower beads interspersed with squash blossom beads

title: Squash Blossom Necklace
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Lower Level, Cabinet 5 Shelf 3, Middle
description: A squash blossom necklace in which silver rod bands make up the naja, with bezels later soldered on for stone insets.  Secondary chisel strikes decorate the flutes of the blossoms.  The beads on the chain are graduated.

title: Squash Blossom Necklace
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Lower Level, Cabinet 5 Shelf 2, Middle
description: Squash blossom necklace with heavy chisel and file cutting of design into Naja.  Secondary solder of domed end tabs and early die stamp of feather with fluted heads are mold hammered.

title: Squash Blossom Necklace
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Lower Level, Cabinet 6 Shelf 3, Right
description: Silver, squash blossom necklace with beads; double-horseshoe-shaped pendant with rounded ends decorated with incised lines; another round piece with incised lines hangs in the middle of the horseshoe

title: Squash Blossom Necklace
dimensions: Overall: 15 x 5 1/2 x 5/8 in. (38.1 x 14 x 1.6 cm)
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 15, North Wall Cabinet, Top Shelf
description: Hand-made squash blossom necklace, bead hammered in block mold with saw and file work to cut out hands of Naja.  Decoration includes chisel cuts around central stone on pendant squash blossom attached by solder to Naja.  Oval stone is flat hand ground and polished.

title: Squash Blossom Necklace
dimensions: Overall: 15 x 6 x 5/8 in. (38.1 x 15.2 x 1.6 cm)
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 15, East Wall Cabinet, Bottom Shelf
description: Squash blossom necklace with handmade beads and ring based tabs for blossom attachments.  The piece has a simple two band Naja with tip caps and a turquoise suspended in center. with silver beads and eight squash blossoms; pendant is horseshoe-shaped with a square piece of turquoise suspended in center

title: Squash Blossom Necklace
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 15, East Wall Cabinet, Bottom Shelf
description: Squash blossom necklace which is all hand made with "toothed" bezel for stones.Squash blossom necklace with silver beads and ten squash-blossom ornaments; pendant is horseshoe-shaped with two oval pieces of turquoise attached

title: Squash Blossom Necklace
dimensions: Overall: 16 x 8 x 3/4 in. (40.6 x 20.3 x 1.9 cm)
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 15, East Wall Cabinet, Top Shelf
description: Squash blossom necklace with  round barrow beads with short squash blossom trumpets which are handmade and of an early design.    The double stringing of beads and blossoms are later innovations (c.1900).  Three commercial silver rods are bent and soldered togerther to fom the Naja.  The cross clover motif is unusual and simple final cuts and chisel strikes provide surface design.

title: Squash Blossom Necklace
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 15, East Wall Cabinet, Top Shelf
description: Very early form of squash blossom necklace in the cluster of bead blossoms tomward tower quarter of necklace and simple two baned Naja.  The double hands are early forms, tile cut for relief.  Unusual addition of later flange tip blossoms to earlier set of simple ring tab blossoms.

title: Squash Blossom Necklace
medium: Silver alloy, turquoise, leather, copper alloy
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 15, North Wall Cabinet, Top Shelf
description: Hand made squash blossom necklace which is bead mold hammer cut and spread blossom heads with edge file cutting.  The central Naja has three concentric silver bands decorated with wire motif cut filing ending with a turquoise stone and stamp work around central rectangular turquoise pendant and at the top of solid silver spline which holds Naja together.  Above the Naja is another triangle shaped turquoise stone.
bibliography1: Dolkart, Judith F., Martha Lucy, and Derek Gillman. The Barnes Foundation: Masterworks. New York: Skira Rizzoli, 2012: 244-245, 249, 254.

title: Squash Blossom Necklace
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 16, North Wall Cabinet, Top Shelf
description: Squash blossom necklace with two banded silver rods that have been scraped to provide channels within the naja on which the surface has secondary die stamping. An old high bezel oval stone is set in the center of the naja and the terminus has a double set of hands. Solder drops and hand rolled wire complete the design.

title: Squash Blossom Necklace
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 16, North Wall Cabinet, Top Shelf
description: Squash blossom necklace composed of double commercial triangular silver rods bent and soldered at terminus with turquoise stones make up Naja.  A "butterfly" winged button with a stone has been secondarily attached to the Naja, connecting it to the beaded necklace.

title: Squash Blossom Necklace
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 16, North Wall Cabinet, Top Shelf
description: Squash blossom necklace composed of the standard two rod construction of the Naja with terminus turquoise stone and central pendant.  The fluted beads are hand made.

title: Squash Blossom Necklace
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 16, East Wall Cabinet, Top Shelf
description: Squash blossom necklace with a single string of beads made of a double-triangular commercial silver rod soldered at terminus make up Naja.  Decoration includes heavy punch repousse domes with galss trade beads on necklace.

title: Squash Blossom Necklace
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 16, East Wall Cabinet, Top Shelf
description: Squash blossom necklace with hand made graduated beads with a sand case Naja with later solder of silver bezel with a turquoise stone earring inset.  The hands of Naja have been replaced by circular disks with a heavy punch decoration.

title: Squash Blossom Necklace
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 16, East Wall Cabinet, Bottom Shelf
description: A squash blossom necklace modified with decorative ears of corn.

title: Squash Blossom Necklace
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 16, East Wall Cabinet, Top Shelf
description: A double strand beaded squash blossom necklace composed of the standard two rod soldered construction of the Naja with terminus turquoise stone inserts and a pendant stone drop.  ALl stones were hand drilled for former "ear drops".

title: Still Life with Gourds (Nature morte aux coloquintes)
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 23, South Wall
description: A still life is arranged on a series of tables in a room with two windows. The walls, table tops, and floor of the room are grey. The two square windows in the upper right are green; a pattern of blue dots on a whitish ground appears in the square on the left. In the foreground on a three-legged table sits a plate with three pieces of yellow fruit, a black basket, and a bouquet of red, yellow and white flowers with green leaves in a transparent green vase. Behind it on the right is an ochre-colored sculpture of a woman's head, and slightly to the left is a second table on which sits a brown lamp-like object. The right edge of an empty yellow picture frame is visible in the left corner, and behind it is a pink table-like square with illeligble objects outlined in black.

title: Storage Jar
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Lower Level, Cabinet 1 Shelf 3, Middle
description: A Santo Domingo Kiua black-on-white storage jar made of buff clay tempered with crystalline and minor basalt inclusions. The jar has a black rim with a red-banded under body and unslipped base. There is a four-fold design layout on the body with vertical line separations secondarily embellished by bifold triangular units with interior lancelet feather motifs. The neck design is zonal with a serial bifold rotation of triangular units. The primary design is Spanish influenced as seen in the four rosettes with six-spoked interior grids and exterior starburst surrounds. There is high mid-body/under body design separation.

title: Storage Jar
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Lower Level, Cabinet 2 Shelf 1, Middle
description: An Acoma four-color polychrome storage jar made of gray-white clay. It has a rounded body, up-thrust neck, black rim, and red underbody. The single zone pattern is broken into two symmetric design units directly opposite one another. Two design units are feathered rosettes with interior four-color bird motifs adapted from Mexican Pueblo and Talaver tiles, as seen in the "S" shaped configuration of the wings and floral display. The connecting units are geometric stacked rectangles and curvilinear rainbirds in red. The rosette units are framed by two-color--red and yellow--rainbow bands.
bibliography1: Dewey, John. Art as Experience. New York: Milton, Balch & Company, 1934, ill. opp. 26.Dolkart, Judith F., Martha Lucy, and Derek Gillman. The Barnes Foundation: Masterworks. New York: Skira Rizzoli, 2012: 344, 345.

title: Storage Jar
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Lower Level, Cabinet 3 Shelf 3, Middle
description: A Santo Domingo black-on-cream storage jar made of buff clay with crystalline temper. The jar has a black rim with a red-banded under body and unslipped base. Two zonal patterns surround the vessel--one at the neck and another around the mid- to lower body. The top neck band uses the traditional triangular units to define negative "U" shaped forms. The mid-body design is based on a serial repetition of diamond shapes that are connected above and below framing lines. The effect is an optical illusion of diamonds or "X"s defined by black triangles.

title: Storage Jar
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Lower Level, Cabinet 4 Shelf 3, Right
description: A Zia polychrome storage jar made of red clay body with basalt slip. The vessel has a globular storage jar shape with a rolled-out, flaring rim for securing a cap covering to the top of the jar. There is a red rim and underbody base and a secondary polished red band. One zonal field of decoration extends from the neck to the junction with the lower underbody and includes four Acoma-influenced parrots perched on flowering fruited branches.

title: Storage Jar
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Lower Level, Cabinet 4 Shelf 4, Middle
description: A Tesuque black-on-cream storage jar made of light buff clay with no visible temper. The vessel has a rounded form, crazed stone polish, white body slip, red rim, heavy red base framing band, and an unslipped floated base. The decoration consists of two zonal design fields--one at the neck, which consists of a serial repetition of "S" scroll of rain birds, and the main body field made up of geometric forms, a Spanish-influenced floral/feather rosette, and a "D" shaped design unit with the interior cross fleur-de-lis.

title: Storage Jar
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Lower Level, Cabinet 5 Shelf 4, Middle
description: A San Ildefonso black-on-cream storage jar made of buff clay with buff temper. The jar has a teardrop shape, white crazed stone polished body slip, red rim, and heavy red polished rounded base with no secondary banding. One primary body design extends from the neck to mid-body and consists of two design systems or four symmetrical units. One unit is a Spanish derived rosette with an interior Maltese cross. The second connecting unit is a geometric composition of triangles, diamonds, and half circles.

title: Storage Jar
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Lower Level, Cabinet 6 Shelf 4, Middle
description: A Santa Ana polychrome storage jar made of red/buff clay with basalt temper. The vessel has a globular body, small tapered up-thrust neck, and flat bottom. The lower body is unslipped with a secondary red polished band surrounding the vessel. There is a light application of white stone polished slip to the main body. One serial repeated zone extending from the neck to two-thirds of the way down the underbelly. Three birds rotate around the vessel connected by a polychrome sunflower. The birds are built around typical "C" or "D" shaped motifs both with and without black framing lines.

title: Storage Jar
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Lower Level, Cabinet 6 Shelf 3, Left
description: A Santa Ana polychrome storage jar made of buff clay with basalt and quartz temper. The vessel has a squat form, flattened upper body flexure, slightly tapered vertical truncated neck, and flat bottom. The jar has a heavy red underbody band surmounting an unpolished base and underbody and a red rim. There are two zones of serially repeated designs. The neck design is a simple repetition of a feather and leaf motif. The main body design emphasizes two large "S" frets ending in a bifold rotational three-feather tipped motif. Classic "C" form motifs in red both with and without black framing lines are evident.

title: Studio with Goldfish (L'Atelier aux poissons rouges)
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 19, South Wall
description: A still life is placed on a brown, wooden table in the foreground of a room with blue walls and a blue floor. The still life consists of a pink statue of a nude woman, a slender, green vase of orange flowers resting on a blue decorated plate and a transparent, blue glass cylinder with three or four goldfish. Under all of this, the table is inlaid with a single yellow ceramic tile. Near the wall on the right is a dark green easel on which rests a canvas (turned away from the viewer), over which hangs a light green cloth of some sort. On the wall above the easel is a picture of a figure in yellow. To the left on the same wall, a door opens into a garden through which a turquoise and blue striped awning and pink and green foliage are visible. A picture of a pink nude hangs on the wall above the open garden door.  In the background on the left is a blue, mullion-paned window.

title: Tankard
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 11, South Wall
description: A large tankard set on a foot with an applied handle, a hinged lid and a finial at the point where the two meet.  The piece has incised decoration of two lions, a loaf of bread and a pretzel with a crown above.

title: Tavern Scene
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 04, South Wall
description: A man in a red jacket and a hat holds up a glass in his right hand while holding a woman around the waist with his left arm. The woman wears a dark blue dress with a green apron and a white hat; she holds a pitcher in her left hand. A group of four figures are gathered  in the left background. A pig and a castle can be seen through an open doorway of the tavern.

title: Teapot
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 14, East Wall
description: A teapot set on a rolled foot with an out-turned rim, an applied spout with a dragon head at the end and an applied handle wrapped in wicker.

title: Teapot
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 15, South Wall
description: A teakettle set on three brass feet with an applied spout ending in a dragon's head, and a hinged handle with an H-shaped wooden handle.

title: Temptation of Saint Anthony
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 05, South Wall
description: St. Anthony kneels in the center of the remains of a building. People and monstrous creatures gather around a table behind him. A fish that is half gondola floats on a river in the foreground, and a creature that resembles a goose emerges from a hollowed out red fruit in the lower left corner. A building burns in the left background.

title: The Artist's Family (La Famille de l'artiste)
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Main Room, East Wall
description: A monumental group portrait set outdoors, with five figures. A woman stands at the apex of the composition, wearing a hat decorated with flowers. To her right is a boy dressed in a sailor suit, leaning on her arm. Across from the boy stands a girl wearing a hat and a red dress, holding a striped ball behind her back. In the foreground a woman kneels down, gently supporting a baby dressed in a white bonnet and garment.

title: The Black Boat (Le Bateau noir)
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 09, South Wall
description: A group of dark-hulled fishing boats with their sails furled and their empty nets spread out to dry on the sand are pulled up onto the shore, which gently curves towards the white cliffs of Etretat in the background. The blue sea is visible behind the boats on the left, while in front of the boats on the right are the sand and seaweed of the shore. In the middleground on the right, a man in red clothing walks along the edge of the beach towards the cliffs, which end in a natural arch. The cliff tops are covered with green grass and a building with a blue roof, probably a church, is set back from the edge of the highest point.

title: The Confidantes
medium: Graphite, charcoal, watercolor, and white gouache on paperboard
locations: Barnes Foundation (Merion), Gallery, G30, Flat File, Drawer 7
description: Two women seated on a daybed.  The woman on the left wears a long, patterned robe.  The woman on the right wears a nightgown and slippers.  Both women's hair is loosely swept back.  They lean towards each other.  The daybed has a pillow and is blue and white with a border of a diamond pattern.  In the background on the right is a dressing table with a ruffled curtain along the edge.  A rug lies on the floor in the foreground with a wood floor beneath.

title: The Green Dress (La Robe verte)
medium: Oil on canvas (later mounted to fiberboard)
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 10, East Wall
description: A woman is seated on a black chair in a room with a green floor. Her legs are crossed and her arms rest on her knees. Her left foot rests on an octagonal Oriental red object. She wears a green robe over a blouse with long grey sleeves, and a white turban. To her right, a pair of stockings carelessly lies on a striped pink and red sofa. The wall in the background consists of three different materials: on the left, behind the sofa, the wallpaper is decorated with a yellow pattern on a white background, to the right of this and behind the model, the wall is orange, and, on the right side, the wall or perhaps the window cavity is represented by a vertical strip of a lighter orange color. Finally, a white curtain appears at the right edge of the canvas.

title: The Madras (Le Madras)
locations: Barnes Foundation (Philadelphia), Collection Gallery, Room 19, East Wall
description: A female figure is depicted from the waist-up seated at a table. She rests her right elbow on the table, and her left hand points to a page in the book as she looks toward the spectator.
